info.title: SOLOMON Training Servers - On Premises
info.description: This API documentation describes the endpoints required for SaturnAI components to communicate with the Training Server Backend.  We are having the Standalone Dashboard but this docs will be user for client who want to have a costume implementation.

post.description:
### Login Endpoint

Used to get a token and refresh token to authenticate to the rest endpoint. The default admin username will be created during the first-time installation, which can be modified by the user during the installation.

#### Request

- **Method**: POST
    
- **URL**: `{{DMG_URL}}/api/v1/logi`
    

#### Request Body

``` json
{
    "username": "string",  // The username of the account
    "password": "string"   // The password for the account
}

 ```

#### Response

- **Response Format**: JSON
    
- **Fields**:
    
    - `refresh_token`: A string representing the refresh token used to obtain new access tokens.
        
    - `token`: A string representing the access token that can be used to authenticate requests.

schema.example: GET, PUT, POST, DELETE, PATCH, OPTIONS
GET, PUT, POST, DELETE, PATCH, OPTIONS

post.description:
## API Request Description

**Endpoint for creating a user.**

### Request:

- **Method:** POST
    
- **URL:** {{DMG_URL}}/api/v1/user
    
- **Headers:**
    
    - `Content-Type`: application/json

        

**Request Body:**

``` json
{
    "name": "string",
    "password": "string",
    "isAdmin": "boolean",
    "license_quota_mins": "integer"
}

 ```

- `name`: The username for the new user.
    
- `password`: The password for the user, which must adhere to general password regulations (e.g., contain uppercase and lowercase letters, numbers, and avoid common passwords).
    
- `isAdmin`: A boolean indicating whether the user is an admin or a normal user.
    
- `license_quota_mins`: An integer representing the total minutes the user can interact with the Solomon training server. For on-premise K8s versions, a large number (e.g., 999999) is typically sufficient.
    

### Response:

- { "id": 0, "last_login": null, "created": "", "updated": "", "name": "", "isAdmin": true, "cvat_user_id": 0, "mlflow_user_id": 0, "license_quota_mins": 0, "license_used_mins": 0}
    
- **Description of fields:**
    
    - `id`: Unique identifier for the user.
        
    - `last_login`: Timestamp of the last login.
        
    - `created`: Timestamp of when the user was created.
        
    - `updated`: Timestamp of the last update.
        
    - `name`: Name of the user.
        
    - `isAdmin`: Boolean indicating if the user is an admin.
        
    - `cvat_user_id`: ID associated with CVAT.
        
    - `mlflow_user_id`: ID associated with MLflow.
        
    - `license_quota_mins`: Total license quota in minutes.
        
    - `license_used_mins`: Minutes of license used.

get.description:
### Get List of Datasets

This endpoint retrieves dataset information related to a CVAT project. It provides a list of datasets available on the server.

#### Successful Response Example

``` json
{
    "data": [
        {
            "created": "2025-06-16",
            "cvat_project_id": 7,
            "dataset_name": "DatasetTest124",
            "id": 7,
            "tool_name": "ObjectDetectionV1",
            "train_box": true,
            "train_mask": true,
            "updated": "2025-06-16",
            "user_id": 2
        }
    ]
}

 ```

#### Response Fields

- **data**: An array of dataset objects.
    
    - **created**: The date when the dataset was created.
        
    - **cvat_project_id**: The ID of the associated CVAT project.
        
    - **dataset_name**: The name of the dataset.
        
    - **id**: The unique identifier for the dataset.
        
    - **tool_name**: The name of the tool used for the dataset.
        
    - **train_box**: Indicates if the dataset includes training boxes.
        
    - **train_mask**: Indicates if the dataset includes training masks.
        
    - **updated**: The date when the dataset was last updated.
        
    - **user_id**: The ID of the user who created or updated the dataset.

schema.example: GET, PUT, POST, DELETE, PATCH, OPTIONS

post.description:
### Create Dataset

This endpoint allows you to create a new dataset on the server.

#### Request

- **Method:** POST
    
- **URL:** `{{DMG_URL}}/api/v1/dataset`
    

#### Request Body

The request body should be in JSON format with the following parameters:

- `dataset_name` (string): The name of the dataset.
    
- `tool_name` (string): The name of the tool being used. The tool name option are:
    
    - `ObjectDetectionV1`
        
    - `ObjectDetectionV2`
        
    - `ClassificationV2`
        
    - `OCR`
        
    - `AnomalyDetectionV1`
        
    - `CountingFM`

        
- `train_box` (boolean): Indicates if box training is enabled.
    
- `train_mask` (boolean): Indicates if mask training is enabled.
    

#### Response

On a successful request, the server will respond with a status code of `200` and a JSON object containing the following fields:

- `id` (integer): The unique identifier for the dataset.
    
- `created` (string, date-time format): The timestamp when the dataset was created.
    
- `updated` (string, date-time format): The timestamp when the dataset was last updated.
    
- `user_id` (integer): The identifier of the user who created the dataset.
    
- `dataset_name` (string): The name of the dataset.
    
- `tool_name` (string): The name of the tool used for the dataset.
    
- `train_box` (boolean): Indicates if box training is enabled.
    
- `train_mask` (boolean): Indicates if mask training is enabled.
    
- `cvat_project_id` (integer): The identifier for the associated CVAT project.
    

### Notes

- Ensure that the `dataset_name` is unique and valid to avoid errors during dataset creation.

post.description:
### Notes:

- `train.json` and `val.json` only support solomon format. Please refer to how to create annotation for solomon dataset.

get.description:
### Endpoint Description

This endpoint retrieves detailed information about a specific dataset identified by its unique ID.

### Request

- **Method**: GET
    
- **URL**: `{{DMG_URL}}/api/v1/dataset/{id}`
    
- **Path Parameters**:
    
    - `id` (integer): The unique identifier of the dataset you wish to retrieve.

        

### Response

Upon a successful request, the server responds with a status code of `200` and a JSON object containing the following fields:

- `annotation` (array): An array that holds annotation data related to the dataset.
    
- `config` (array): An array that contains configuration settings for the dataset.
    
- `created_at` (string): A timestamp indicating when the dataset was created.
    
- `cvat_project_id` (integer): The ID of the associated CVAT project, if applicable.
    
- `dataset_name` (string): The name of the dataset.
    
- `id` (integer): The unique identifier of the dataset.
    
- `image` (array): An array containing image data associated with the dataset.
    
- `tool_name` (string): The name of the tool used for the dataset.
    
- `user_id` (integer): The ID of the user who created or owns the dataset.

schema.example: GET, PUT, POST, DELETE, PATCH, OPTIONS

get.description:
## Retrieve Dataset Configuration

This endpoint allows you to retrieve the configuration for a specific dataset identified by `DATASET_ID` and `CONFIG_NAME`.

### Request

- **Method**: `GET`
    
- **Endpoint**: `{{DMG_URL}}/api/v1/dataset/{{DATASET_ID}}/config/{{CONFIG_NAME}}.json`
    

### Parameters

- `DATASET_ID`: The unique identifier for the dataset whose configuration you wish to retrieve.
    
- `CONFIG_NAME`: The name of the configuration you want to access. The options are: `voc_config.json, train.json, val.json`
    
    - `voc_config.json` will contain training parameter things
        
    - `train.json` is the configuration of training data which will contain the annotation for each image will be use for training
        
    - `val.json` is same with `train.json` but will only use during validation.

        

### Response

- **Status Code**: `200 OK`
    
- **Content-Type**: `application/json`
    

The response contains a JSON object with a `data` field, which may return `null` if there is no configuration available for the specified dataset and configuration name.

### Notes:

- `train.json` and `val.json` only support solomon format. Please refer to how to create annotation for solomon dataset.
